meanings.definition: Not requiring much skill or intelligence
meanings.sent1: The task was so menial that anyone could do it.
meanings.sent2: She found joy in the simple, menial tasks around the house.
meanings.sent3: Even the most menial chores can be fun with the right attitude.
meanings.sent4: His menial job felt like a never-ending cycle of monotony.
meanings.sent5: The menial nature of the job made it easy for beginners to learn.

meanings.definition: A person who does boring or unpleasant work
meanings.sent1: The menial was responsible for cleaning the office every evening.
meanings.sent2: She felt unappreciated in her role as a menial at the factory.
meanings.sent3: The menial always had a smile on his face despite the tedious tasks.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the protagonist started as a menial but worked his way up.
meanings.sent5: The menial's hard work often went unnoticed by others.
